title: Side Stand - Clean/Lubricate

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Side Stand - Removal - D54; D71; D74; DC; DC3; DC4; DCX; DR4; DS1; DS4; DSA; DSB; DSX; DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4
Wear hand, eye and face protection when unhooking the stand spring. Take great care to minimise the risk of personal injury and loss of components.
With the side stand in the up position, unhook the spring from the side stand and remove it from the motorcycle.
Remove and discard the E-clip securing the pivot pin.
Remove the pivot pin and remove the side stand.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DCZ; DS4; DR4; D74; D54; DX4; DW4; DC4; D71; DVY; DW; DVX; DV; DSB; DSA; DSX; DS1; DC3; DC

body.body: Inspect the surfaces of the pivot pin, side stand carrier bracket and side stand for corrosion or damage and replace if required.
Side Stand - Installation - D74; DR4; DS4; DR5; DS5
Prior to fitting the side stand ensure the pivot pin and the bushes in the side stand are clean and free from grease.
Apply a smear of proprietary general purpose grease to NLGI specification
2/3, to the inner faces of the side stand.

body.name: Side stand area to grease_DR4; DS4; D74L0667_2

body.body: Fit the side stand to the motorcycle and insert the pivot pin.
Fit a new E-clip to secure the pivot pin.
Wear hand, eye and face protection when fitting the stand spring. Take great care to minimise the risk of personal injury and loss of components.
Hook the spring onto its frame lug then carefully hook it onto the side stand lug.
Check the operation of the side stand before riding the motorcycle. Ensure the spring holds the stand securely in the retracted position.
